Change.Title: The BRAINS2MaskImageIO class is removed.
Change.Description: The Brains2Mask file format has very limited functionality outside the legacy brains2 program. This file format does not have sufficient information for supporting orientation of masks, and even the Iowa contributors have given up on using the ITK Brains2Mask as a file format from ITK. This is a legacy format that was never included in the default file reader lists.

SampleCode.New: // Don't include headers or register factory

Change.FileList: Code/IO/CMakeLists.txt Code/IO/itkBrains2HeaderBase.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2HeaderBase.h Code/IO/itkBrains2HeaderFactory.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2HeaderFactory.h Code/IO/itkBrains2IPLHeaderInfo.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2IPLHeaderInfo.h Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskHeaderInfo.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskHeaderInfo.h Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskImageIO.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskImageIO.h Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskImageIOFactory.cxx Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskImageIOFactory.h Testing/Code/IO/CMakeLists.txt Testing/Code/IO/itkBrains2MaskImageIOTest.cxx Testing/Code/IO/itkIOHeaderTest.cxx

MigrationFix-Manual.New: Remove #include statemets for BRAINS2Mask classes. Remove c++ statement that registered the BRAINS2Mask factory. In the unlikely event you need to convert BRAINS2 masks, there is a program included in the BRAINS3 project on nitrc.org, called ConvertMaskToBinaryImage, that can be used to do this. See http://www.
